title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: Scott's High-school wasthe second of that name. It is now the City Hospital, at the foot of Inﬁrmary Street, and so far asits exterior is concerned it is entirely unchanged. A story of his conduct here, as told by himself, istoo good to be lost.

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: The ﬁrst "Hie Schule" of Edinburgh, in whichDrummond was a pupil, was built in I567, in thegarden of the monastery of the Blackfriars, at theeast end of the present Inﬁrmary Street, and nearthe head of what was once the High-school ¥Vynd. It was taken down in I777, to make room for thesecond High-school, which is now the City Hospital. The present University buildings, datingback only from I789, stand upon the site of theoriginal establishment, no portion of which has beenpreserved.

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: City Cross, 31. City Hospital, 14,49. City of Glasgow InsuranceCompany, 61.
